data.title: Sketch Comedy Movies - Hillsborough County Public Library Cooperative
data.meta_description: Sketch Comedy Movies by HCPLC_Flicks - a staff-created list : The success of the National Lampoon magazine and the TV series "Saturday Night Live" in the 1970s led to an explosion of sketch comedy movies, a genre that has continued into the 2000s and beyond. Whether they're anthology films made up of one sketch after another or movies that attempt to thread the style of popular sketch comedians' work into a continuous narrative, lovers of sketch comedy should find lots to appreciate here.
data.text:
One of the earliest sketch comedy films, "The Kentucky Fried Movie" contains largely unconnected sketches that parody various film genres, inclu...Show more One of the earliest sketch comedy films, "The Kentucky Fried Movie" contains largely unconnected sketches that parody various film genres, including kung-fu films (" A Fistful of Yen"), disaster films ("That's Armageddon"), blaxploitation films ("Cleopatra Schwartz") and women-in-prison films ("Catholic High School Girls in Trouble"). The film was written by David Zucker, Jim Abrahams, and Jerry Zucker, who subsequently wrote and directed "Airplane!", "Top Secret!", and "The Naked Gun". Show less

National Lampoon's Movie Madness was presented as the second film produced by the popular humor magazine after the success of their first film "Anima...Show more National Lampoon's Movie Madness was presented as the second film produced by the popular humor magazine after the success of their first film "Animal House". Movie Madness consists of three short segments which satirize personal growth films, glossy soap operas, and police stories. Show less

From the twisted mind of one of Saturday Night Live's most notorious early writers, Michael O'Donoghue, this TV special was originally scheduled to air d...Show more From the twisted mind of one of Saturday Night Live's most notorious early writers, Michael O'Donoghue, this TV special was originally scheduled to air during one of SNL's hiatuses, but was summarily rejected by NBC as too outrageous for broadcast. A spoof of the controversial 1962 documentary "Mondo Cane", the film is largely plotless- a series of vignettes linked together by interstitial pieces featuring Mr. Mike discussing how upsetting and odd the sequences are. Show less

From comedy legend Mel Brooks comes a humorous look at the ages of man, from caveman times to stories set during the Roman Empire, the Spanish Inquisition...Show more From comedy legend Mel Brooks comes a humorous look at the ages of man, from caveman times to stories set during the Roman Empire, the Spanish Inquisition and the French Revolution. Other intermediate skits include reenactments of the delivery of the Ten Commandments and the Last Supper. The large ensemble cast features many Brooks regulars like Dom DeLuise, Madeline Kahn, Harvey Korman, and Cloris Leachman. Despite carrying the title Part 1, there is no sequel. Show less

Unlike "Holy Grail" and "Life of Brian", which each told a single, more or less straightforward story, "The Meaning of Life&quot...Show more Unlike "Holy Grail" and "Life of Brian", which each told a single, more or less straightforward story, "The Meaning of Life" returned to the sketch format of the British comedy troupe's original television series. The film is loosely structured as a series of comic sketches about the various stages of life, from the miracle of birth through to death and the afterlife. It is the last film to feature all six Python members before Graham Chapman died in 1989. Show less

An anthology film by independent film director Jim Jarmusch, "Coffee and Cigarettes" consists of 11 short stories, shot in black and white, whic...Show more An anthology film by independent film director Jim Jarmusch, "Coffee and Cigarettes" consists of 11 short stories, shot in black and white, which are built upon one another to create a cumulative effect. The characters discuss things such as caffeine popsicles, Paris in the 1920s, and the use of nicotine as an insecticide â€“ all while drinking coffee and smoking cigarettes. The film features actors like Robert Benigni, Steven Wright, Steve Buscemi and Steve Coogan, as well as musicians Tom Waits, Iggy Pop, and Jack and Meg White of the White Stripes playing themselves. Show less

Based on the satirical newspaper and website of the same name, The Onion Movie deals with a TV news anchorman who is forced to face the inevitability of a...Show more Based on the satirical newspaper and website of the same name, The Onion Movie deals with a TV news anchorman who is forced to face the inevitability of a corporate takeover by fictitious multinational Global Tetrahedron. The plot serves as a springboard for various comedy sketches featuring The Onion's biting humor. Vignettes include parodies of music videos reminiscent of Britney Spears' work and Steven Seagal appearing as a parody of the type of action hero he normally portrays. Show less

A series of interconnected short films follows a washed-up producer as he pitches insane story lines for movies featuring some of the biggest stars in Hol...Show more A series of interconnected short films follows a washed-up producer as he pitches insane story lines for movies featuring some of the biggest stars in Hollywood. The film's segments were directed by several different directors, but the project was overseen by Peter Farrelly ("There's Something About Mary"). The large ensemble cast includes Elizabeth Banks, Halle Berry, Anna Faris, Hugh Jackman, Chris Pratt, Emma Stone, Jason Sudeikis, Naomi Watts and Kate Winslet, among many others. Show less

In the sketch comedy film "InAPPropriate Comedy", a series of offensive apps stir up cultural anarchy, with stars including Adrien Brody, Rob Sc...Show more In the sketch comedy film "InAPPropriate Comedy", a series of offensive apps stir up cultural anarchy, with stars including Adrien Brody, Rob Schneider, Michelle Rodriguez and Lindsay Lohan making sure no taboo is left untouched. The film was directed by Vince Offer (aka "The ShamWow Guy"), as a sequel to his previous anthology, "The Underground Comedy Movie". Show less

Cheech & Chong had been a counterculture comedy team putting out sketch comedy albums for about ten years before they started reworking some of their ...Show more Cheech & Chong had been a counterculture comedy team putting out sketch comedy albums for about ten years before they started reworking some of their material for their first film. The two play slackers who unknowingly smuggle a van made entirely of marijuana from Mexico to L.A., with incompetent Sgt. Stedenko on their trail. While negatively received upon its release, Up in Smoke grossed over $104 million, is credited with establishing the stoner film genre, and is now considered a classic. Show less

All the McKenzie brothers want is a free case of beer, so they put a mouse in a beer bottle and go to the Elsinore Brewery to complain. There they encount...Show more All the McKenzie brothers want is a free case of beer, so they put a mouse in a beer bottle and go to the Elsinore Brewery to complain. There they encounter the diabolical Brewmeister Smith, who has concocted a scheme to rule the world by contaminating Elsinore Beer with a mind-controlling chemical. Based on the popular characters from the seminal Canadian sketch comedy series "SCTV". Show less

Directed by David Wain, founding member of the MTV sketch comedy group The State, this comedy takes place during the last day at fictional Camp Firewood i...Show more Directed by David Wain, founding member of the MTV sketch comedy group The State, this comedy takes place during the last day at fictional Camp Firewood in 1981, and spoofs the sex comedies aimed at teen audiences of that era. The film features an ensemble cast including Janeane Garofalo, David Hyde Pierce, Molly Shannon, and Paul Rudd, as well as most of the other members of The State. The film was a critical and commercial failure, but has since developed a cult following, Show less

"Mystery Team" is a 2009 comedy by the sketch comedy group Derrick Comedy, whose members include "Community" and "Atlanta" s...Show more "Mystery Team" is a 2009 comedy by the sketch comedy group Derrick Comedy, whose members include "Community" and "Atlanta" star Donald Glover. The movie also marks the feature film debuts for "Parks and Recreation"'s Aubrey Plaza and "Saturday Night Live"'s Bobby Moynihan. Once kid detectives, the Mystery Team are now eighteen and still solving child crimes. But when they are challenged to solve a murder, they see an opportunity to prove they're real detectives, and save the world from sex, crime, and swear words. Show less

Based on the recurring "Saturday Night Live" sketch, this parody of the TV series "MacGyver" features SNL cast members Will Forte and ...Show more Based on the recurring "Saturday Night Live" sketch, this parody of the TV series "MacGyver" features SNL cast members Will Forte and Kristen Wiig. In the 10 years since his fiancÃ©e was killed, special op MacGruber has sworn off a life of fighting crime with his bare hands. But when he learns his country needs him to find a nuclear warhead that's been stolen by his sworn enemy, MacGruber teams up with his trusty sidekick and an uptight lieutenant to get the job done. Show less
